Text.Value: But it is true that I feel some manner of - responsibility - for this unhatched whelp.
I don't suppose you'd consider parenting the child when it hatches.
After we free Orpheus we can visit the matter. If the egg hatches beforehand...
Bah - that was a githyanki egg, not some arcane curiosity for pawning off on shady scholars!

EditorData.logicalname: Nested - AskedAboutGivingEggAway (also can start as WRD)

Text.Value: It has afforded us as much disquiet as it has rest.
Better the egg were destroyed than to spawn such... such an anomaly.
How might that boy have served his people, if he'd only been given the chance?
Mother Gith would have me look ahead, never behind. But I can only wonder -
The egg is not distraction, it is stimulation. It harbours not just a fledgling, but a testament of my mission.
Hush up. You're lucky I didn't make an omelette out of it.
A future I will fight for, and one I would die for.
The egg grows ever warmer, the hum of life within it louder. It may yet hatch - though not soon, by my estimation.
Well. Most certainly not. Githyanki are raised by a varsh and trained by a sa'varsh. We are neither.
Life still pulses inside that egg. It could nurture a great future kith'rak, a winner of wars, and you chucked it at the first bidder.
It's just an egg, Lae'zel. If it were going to hatch, it already would have.
Leave the egg with me. There's no need for further discussion.
Shka'keth!
An unhatched githyanki egg should be the burden of a varsh, not a warrior, whether ascended or otherwise.

EditorData.logicalname: Nested - AboutGettingEgg (also can start as WRD)

Text.Value: If only...

EditorData.NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

Text.Value: I don't suppose you'd consider parenting the child when it hatches.
Fine, keep it with you.
We should keep it in camp, away from danger.
And yet - I'm drawn to the warmth of it. A child of Gith and a servant of Vlaakith grows within.

EditorData.NodeContext: A momentary maternal instinct comes over Lae'zel

Text.Value: But it might also beget a fighter. And I intend to give it the chance.
We should keep it in camp, away from danger.
... well. We will shield it from the lich queen's zealots. Whatever may come, I will not let Vlaakith poison the fledgling with lies.
Thank you.
His death was a blessed escape. He could never understand the weight of Vlaakith's chains... or the relief to come when Orpheus lifts them.
The egg is gone? Chk - I was a fool to let you anywhere near it.
He will never suffer under Vlaakith's yoke. But he will also never see the crash of the Comet, or live freely in the prince's glow.
You're getting attached! Should I start calling you 'Mommy Lae'zel'?
A fragile thing - easily lost, easily broken. But inside it, I glimpsed a speck of my people's future.
The egg is gone. Chk.
Chk. Then I will entrust the egg to you. Begrudgingly, if it weren't obvious.
An effigy of githyanki destiny, incubating before our very eyes.
After we free Orpheus we can revisit the matter. If the egg hatches beforehand...
The egg is a distraction. It can stay where it is.
Life still pulses inside it. The egg could nurture a great future kith'rak, a winner of wars, and you chucked it to the first bidder.
I know it is a mere egg. It may never hatch. If it does, it might beget a failure.
You can still take it back by force. You've spilled your share of blood. What's a little more, if it means proving you haven't fully lost your failing senses?
If the egg survives in your care, I invite you to wallow in my wrongness with all the glee you can conjure.
No. The egg is better off where it is.
In its heat lives stimulation, and in its throbbing, exhilaration. An effigy of githyanki future, incubated inside a fragile shell.
Perhaps I might be the one to teach it of Vlaakith's Protocols.
And yet - I'm drawn to the warmth of it. A child of Gith grows within.
You're getting attached! Should I start calling you 'Mommy Lae'zel'?
Leave.
Though perhaps - perhaps it was inevitable.
Take the egg.

EditorData.logicalname: Player has egg, gives to Lae'zel

Text.Value: He deserved to know Vlaakith's protocols, slaughtered ghaik, ascended and known his queen's undead glory.
Keep it close. Perhaps in our care, it might yet hatch.
No, I must look only ahead, never behind. I suggest you do the same.
Perhaps Crche K'liir would take them in. Sa'varsh Urlon is a stern taskmaster. The fledgling would be stronger and smarter by dint of his teachings.
The very notion puts me ill at ease. Our camp has been visited by a scheming devil and tainted by the Chosen of Bhaal.

EditorData.logicalname: Wyll not part of team, Orin has visited

Text.Value: Give it to me. Perhaps it will fare better under my care.
You are right - I have failed our people. But what more can be done?
You're right, Lae'zel. But what's done is done.
Vlaakith would never ascend a deviant like this. He will never know her protocols, never ride a dragon to the City of Death.
The very notion puts me ill at ease. Our camp has been visited by all manner of devils and tainted by the Chosen of Bhaal.

EditorData.logicalname: Wyll is part of team, Orin has visited

Text.Value: Githyanki are raised by a varsh and trained by a sa'varsh. We are neither.
A camp once visited by a scheming devil is no safe haven for the unhatched. It has afforded us as much disquiet as it has rest.
Perhaps if he'd lived...

EditorData.NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

Text.Value: Who knows what atrocities will be inflicted upon it? I would have expected better of a child of Gith.
Who knows what atrocities will be inflicted upon it?
And don't you dare pass it to that lunatic woman prowling the mountain pass.
Should the egg hatch, we will find a suitable home for the whelp. I will hand it to the kith'raki when the time comes.
Bah. Parentage - a notion so foreign I was sure it was fiction when I first read of it in the slates.
Only if you want me to roast you over a campfire using my blade as a spit.

Synopsis:
Dialog with Laezel regarding the Gith egg.

- Conversation about just taking it from the hatchery

- Conversation after players give the egg to Lady Esther

- If players kept it in Act3:
- - Conversation about how the egg is doing. Reactivity based on whether it's in Laezel's inventory. Later in epilogue, if it was in her inventory, it would be hatched and she would be mentioning it.

- If players lose the egg or get it destroyed before reaching Act3:
- - Laezel is not yet attached to it, so she mentions that it wouldn't have survived anyway

- If players lose the egg or get it destroyed after reaching Act3:
- - Conversation about Laezel being mad at you for not taking good enough care of it

- If players gave it to Lady Esther, after seeing the hatched gith in Act3:
- - Conversation about what happened to the kid and how he turned out, depending on Laezel's current views and outcomes of the situation (boy attacked you and you killed him OR convinced him that you're good or he's flawed in his beliefs and he didn't attack you)

Follow up in Epilogue:
- If Laezel kept the egg, it hatches and she can talk more about it
- If players kept the egg or left it in camp, it hatches and we get a Gazette update about it
- If players destroyed or misplaced the egg, it's not mentioned in the epilogue
